New Records: Keider Montero threw a Maddux, a shutout in fewer than 100 pitches, becoming the first Tigers pitcher to face the minimum 27 batters since Justin Verlander in 2011.
Key Match Events: Keider Montero struck out Jordan Beck of the Colorado Rockies on his 96th pitch, culminating in an 11-0 victory for the Detroit Tigers.
Montero induced three double plays and gave up only three hits with no walks.
Despite catcher Dillon Dingler being scratched with illness, Montero and Jake Rogers implemented the game plan effectively.
Pre-Game Insights: Montero was coming off an outing where he gave up five earned runs over 4 1/3 innings against the San Diego Padres.
Montero has been working relentlessly, studying mechanics, jogging up and down stadium steps, and adding a sinker to his arsenal.
Post-Match Reflections: Montero expressed pride and happiness for the work performed, describing the moment as 'over the clouds'.
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch praised Montero's versatility, competitiveness, and the development of his pitching arsenal.
Hinch and players deflected questions about the wild-card race, focusing instead on the contributions of players like Montero.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Montero's performance was described as the best by Parker Meadows, who noted he didn't have to run around much, indicating a strong pitching performance.
Gabe Ribas, the Tigers' director of pitching, was in attendance and has been instrumental in Montero's development.
